title: What happened to Azir?
body:
How come Azir's popularity has skyrocketed?

He used to hover around a nice 2/3% pick rate, but now he's suddenly since a week or two ago he's at 10% with a 14% ban rate.

What happened? Obviously he wasn't drastically buffed or anything, did one of those damn pro's play him in something important?

Is this a temporary rise in popularity? and soon people will be like 'fuck this I'm going back to Garen!' or will he become another Lee-sin?

I pay no attention to the pro scene so if that is why he is popular atm, could someone tell me the details? thanks :)

replies.body: He's coming back into the LCS which means, he comea back into Solo Queue. He's coming back into the LCS because sustained damage is better than burst against tanks, tanks are back into the meta, Azir has the best sustained damage in the mid lane. Etc.

The new SKT Azir skin is probably the reason why.

The community complained when Rito didn't make a skin for Easyhoon.
No, it's probably just the pro scene using Azir (korea and NA) in their matches, also they 'fixed' his w and did something with some other abilities to make him less buggy.
There **HAS** been quite a bit of pro play on Azir recently, especially in the LCK and NA LCS
Bug fixes and slight changes (to his e) in previous patches made Azir smoother and easier. Less bugs also means he is less prone to do undesirable things like glitch out too.
I have played so much azir in the last three weeks, as he is my main now. have to say i haven't seen many others play him when i go jg etc
